function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Focussing on three very different cities -Jerusalem, Phnom Penh and Torontothey reveal how histories of colonial occupation and planning, of postcolonial economic modernization and of entrepreneurial planning geared to promoting competitive global cities have produced conditions germane to the uneven spread and impacts of Covid-19.","Impact":"Uneven spread and impacts of Covid-19 due to historical factors and urban planning practices.","Mitigation":"Incorporate historical and urban planning considerations into pandemic response strategies.","Technologies":"Urban planning, historical research, and geopolitical analysis.","People":"Residents of cities with complex historical and geopolitical contexts.","Owner":"Urban planners, policymakers, and historical researchers."}]}
